```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
R <- sample(1:100, 3) # resistance (ohms)

ans <- sum(R)
dis <- c(1 / sum(1/R))

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, wrong = dis, range = c(0.5, 2)*ans, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE, digits = 5)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\,\\mathsf{\\Omega}$", signif(sc$questions, 2))
```
Question
========
Three resistors are connected in **series**. Their resistances are $`r R[1]` \,\mathsf{\Omega}$, $`r R[2]` \,\mathsf{\Omega}$, and $`r R[3]` \,\mathsf{\Omega}$. What is the equivalent resistance of the resistors?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
The equivalent resistance of resistors in series is the sum of the resistances.

$$R = R_1 + R_2 + R_3 = `r ans` \,\mathsf{\Omega}$$
